summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the law firm Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, demanding production of all non-privileged documents related to the civil litigation 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.' The subpoena is part of a federal criminal investigation into suspected violations of sex trafficking and related statutes, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Signs the subpoena cover letter and the subpoena itself as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the demand for records.

persons.name: Jane Doe 43
persons.context: Is the plaintiff in the referenced civil litigation 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.' which is the subject of the subpoenaed documents.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which Boies Schiller Flexner LLP is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested documents.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena is issued and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Boies Schiller Flexner LLP, 575 Lexington Avenue, New York, NY 10022
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official federal grand jury investigation into suspected felony violations, specifically citing 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion and enticement).
The subpoena specifically targets all non-privileged documents related to the civil case 'Jane Doe 43 v. Epstein, et al.,' indicating the criminal investigation is directly linked to that litigation.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests the law firm not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing investigation.
The document reveals the federal government was actively using grand jury powers to gather evidence from a law firm involved in civil litigation against Epstein as of February 2019.
The subpoena demands a wide range of materials including discovery, depositions, court filings, evidence, and settlement agreements from the referenced civil litigation.
